intro: Hieracium revocanum, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
